table.name: [dbo].[PhotoObj]
table.remarks: This is the Point Source Catalog.
table.column: unique identification number for the PSC source
right ascension
declination
Cartesian coordinate x
Cartesian coordinate y
Cartesian coordinate z
Unique HTM ID
major axis of position error ellipse
minor axis of position error ellipse
position angle of error ellipse major axis
source designation formed from sexigesimal coordinates
J default magnitude
J corrected magnitude uncertainty
J total mag uncertainty
J band scan signal-to-noise ratio
H default magnitude
H corrected magnitude uncertainty
H total mag uncertainty
H band scan signal-to-noise ratio
K default magnitude
K corrected magnitude uncertainty
K total mag uncertainty
K band scan signal-to-noise ratio
photometric quality flag
source of JHK default mags (read flag)
indicates no of JHK components fit to source (each digit 0|1|2)
indicates artifact contamination and/or confusion
frame detection statistics
distance between this source and its nearest neighbor in the PSC
position angle on the sky of the vector from the source to the nearest neighbor in the PSC
pts_key value of the nearest source in the PSC
indicates src associated with or contaminated by an ext. src
source is positionally associated with an asteroid or comet
hemisphere (N/S) of observation
observation date
scan number (unique within date)
galactic longitude, rounded to 0.001 deg
galactic latitude, rounded to 0.001 deg
mean cross-scan focal plane position of the source in the U-scan coordinate system
Julian Date of the source measurement accurate to +-30 seconds
J band reduced chi-squared value of fit
H band reduced chi-squared value of fit
K band reduced chi-squared value of fit
J standard aperture magnitude or BF aperture-photometry mag
J standard ap. mag/BF ap.-photometry mag uncertainty
H standard aperture magnitude or BF aperture-photometry mag
H standard ap. mag/BF ap.-photometry mag uncertainty
K standard aperture magnitude or BF aperture-photometry mag
K standard ap. mag/BF ap.-photometry mag uncertainty
distance from the source to the nearest North or South scan edge
distance from the source to the nearest East or West scan edge
two character flag that specifies to which scan edges a source lies closest
duplicate source flag
use source flag
catalog identifier of an optical source from either the Tycho 2 or USNO-A2.0 catalog
distance in arcsec relative to associated optical source
position angle relative to assocaited optical source
catalog blue mag of associated optical source
catalog red magnitude of the associated optical source
number of optical sources within 5 arcsec of 2MASS src
unique identification number of the record in the XSC that corresponds to this point source
unique identification number of the record in the Scan Information Table
unique identification number of the record in the Atlas Image Data Table
sequence number of the Atlas Image in which the position of this source falls
default J-H mag color
default H-K mag color
default J-K mag color

table.name: [dbo].[PhotoXSC]
table.column: Julian Date of the source measurement accurate to +30 seconds. (See 2MASS PSC documentation).
Sexagesimal, equatorial position-based source name in the form: hhmmssss+ddmmsss[ABC...].
Super-coadd centroid RA (J2000 decimal deg).
Super-coadd centroid Dec (J2000 decimal deg).
Coadd log(density) of stars with k<14 mag.

extended score: 1(extended) < e_score < 2(point-like).
galaxy score: 1(extended) < g_score < 2(point-like).
visual verification score for source.
indicates artifact contamination and/or confusion.
size of postage stamp image in pixels.

number of blanked source records.
number of subtracted source records.
blanked/subtracted src description flag.
type/galaxy ID flag (0=non-catalog, 1=catalog, 2=LCSB).
matched galaxy catalog name.
flux-growth convergence flag.
LCSB blocking factor (1, 2, 4, 8).
Duplicate source flag.
Use source flag.
Proximity. The distance between this source and its nearest neighbor in the PSC.
The position angle on the sky of the vector from the source to the nearest neighbor in the PSC, East of North.
ext_key value of nearest XSC source.
The distance from the source to the nearest North or South scan edge.
The distance from the source to the nearest East or West scan edge.
flag indicating which edges ([n|s][e|w]) are nearest to src.
key to point source data DB record.
key to minor planet prediction DB record.
key to night data record in "scan DB".
key to scan data record in "scan DB".
key to coadd data record in "scan DB".
hemisphere (N/S) of observation. "n" = North/Mt. Hopkins; "s" = South/CTIO.
The observation reference date for this source expressed in ISO standard format.
scan number (unique within date).
3-digit coadd number (unique within scan).
x (cross-scan) position (coadd coord.).
y (in-scan) position (coadd coord.).

H residual background #2 (score).
K residual background #2 (score).
J coadd median background.
K coadd median background.
J residual annulus background median.
H residual annulus background median.
K residual annulus background median.

J banding maximum FT amplitude on this side of coadd.
K banding Fourier Transf. period on this side of coadd.
K banding maximum FT amplitude on this side of coadd.
J band seetracking score.
H band seetracking score.
K band seetracking score.
entry counter (key) number (unique within table).

table.name: [dbo].[ScanInfo]
table.column: The unique identification number for this scan
Observatory from which data were obtained (n/s)
The observation reference date for this scan expressed in ISO standard format
Scan number (unique within date)
Tile identification number
Right ascension of scan center for equinox J2000
Declination of scan center for equinox J2000
Galactic longitude of scan center, as computed from ra and dec
Galactic latitude of scan center, as computed from ra and dec
J2000 right ascension of the eastern corner at start of scan
J2000 declination of the eastern corner at start of scan
J2000 right ascension of the western corner at start of s
J2000 declination of the western corner at start of scan
J2000 right ascension of the eastern corner at end of scan
J2000 declination of the eastern corner at end of scan
J2000 right ascension of the western corner at end of scan
J2000 declination of the western corner at end of scan
Scanning direction (north-going or south-going)
Quality score for scan (10 is highest grade,0 is lowest)
flag indicating whether(1) or not(0) the scan has a single-frame H-band electronic glitch
flag indicating whether or not a cloud was found in the scan after comparison (1 indicates clouds)
flag indicating whether(1) or not(0) another photometric problem, not obviously cloud related, was found
flag indicating whether(1) or not(0) an unusual problem was found in the Atlas Images for this scan
Universal Time (UT) at beginning of scan
Julian Date at beginning of scan
Airmass at beginning of scan
Scan's distance from the zenith at beginning of scan
Hour angle at beginning of scan
Relative humidity of telescope enclosure at beginning of scan
Air temperature at beginning of scan
Telescope girdle temperature at beginning of scan
Focus setting of telescope at beginning of scan
Flag indicating the H-band array configuration for the camera (1 indicates the new configuration)
Flag indicating the calibration strategy for this night's data
Photometric zero-point for J-band aperture photometry
Photometric zero-point for H-band aperture photometry
Photometric zero-point for Ks-band aperture photometry
RMS-error of zero-point for H-band aperture photometry
RMS-error of zero-point for Ks-band aperture photometry
Number of point sources at J-band with SNR>10 (instrumental mag <=15.8)
Number of point sources at H-band with SNR>10 (instrumental mag <=15.1)
Number of point sources at Ks-band with SNR>10 (instrumental mag <=14.3)
Number of regular extended sources detected in scan
J-band average seeing shape for scan
H-band average seeing shape for scan
Ks-band average seeing shape for scan
RMS-error of J-band average seeing shape
RMS-error of H-band average seeing shape
RMS-error of Ks-band average seeing shape
J-band average 2nd image moment ratio
H-band average 2nd image moment ratio
Ks-band average 2nd image moment ratio
J-band photometric sensitivity paramater (PSP).
H-band photometric sensitivity parameter (PSP).
Ks-band photometric sensitivity parameter (PSP).
log10 of the mode of the noise distribution (noise estimated from J-band)
log10 of the mode of the noise distribution (noise estimated from H-band)
log10 of the mode of the noise distribution (noise estimated from Ks-band)
The J-band magnitude at which SNR=10 is achieved for this scan
The H-band magnitude at which SNR=10 is achieved for this scan
The Ks-band magnitude at which SNR=10 is achieved for this scan
Flag indicating whether the scan is contained in the 2MASS Sampler Release
Flag indicating whether the scan is contained in the 2MASS First Incremental Data Release (IDR1)
Flag indicating whether the scan is contained in the 2MASS Second Incremental Data Release (IDR2)
